1dc 1sc 1dc 1sc row 197 w 1 row single_crochet row 198 r 1dc 3 single_crochet 2dc to last 4 stitches - 3sc 1dc 14 congratulations you have completed the red forest throw border information you will notice you now have 2 sides with a lot of tails you can deal with these in the following ways sew all your ends in this is a mammoth job believe me as i have done this in the past once it took ages the finished blanket did look good but it took rather a long time twisted tails border the tails on the border are left neat and tidy and look rather special note if you do want to use the twisted tails version you will have to adjust the length of the tails on each row as well as the amount of yarn you use i have put the link here by tinna thorudottir thorvaldar https //www google com/search q=twisted+tails+border&oq=&aqs=chrome 0 35i39i3 62l8 1416j0j15&sourceid=chrome&ie=utf- 8#fpstate=ive&vld=cid 3efb7709 vid quygnsrgk0q envelope border this is the border i have used to complete my throw this border gives the throw a more professional finish also with this border you can be creative and pick a pattern from the throw and really make it your own i have put the link here by tinna thorudottir thorvaldar https //www youtube com/watch v=quygnsrgk0q&list=rdcmuccletbus9y_v1o2bp sjj-oa&start_radio=1&rv=quygnsrgk0q 15 i hope you have enjoyed crocheting your own version
